schema_conversion

Class SchemaConvert

  • java.lang.Object
    • schema_conversion.SchemaConvert

  • public class SchemaConvert
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that translates the graph database schema that Neo4j uses, into a set of relations that can be executed on a relational database. This includes relations for all the nodes and relationships, as well as more specific ones for each label type and type of relationship. Additional metafiles are created to help the translator and output module of Reagan.

    The class makes use of parallel processing on the original dump file to optimise speed up. The original dump file from Neo4J needs to be parsed beforehand, as it contains unnecessary line breaks, as well as characters that will not work in SQL. The c2s_props.properties file states the location of the 'work area', which is used as scratch space for this method.

    • Method Detail

      • translate

        public static boolean translate(java.lang.String file)
        Main method for translating the schema.
        Parameters:
        file - The dump file to be parsed and converted.
        Returns:
        True if the conversion of the dump file to a more manageable form for inserting into the target database was successful; false otherwise.

      • performPreProcessFile

        private static int performPreProcessFile(java.lang.String file)
        Preprocess the original file to remove line breaks and to format it correctly for insertion into a relational backend.
        Parameters:
        file - File location of the dump file.
        Returns:
        Number of lines in the file, or -1 if there was a failure in this method.

      • combineWork

        private static void combineWork(java.lang.String[] files)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Concatenate result of individual threads to one file. One method call does this for both the nodes and relationships.
        Parameters:
        files - n files resulted from reading initial dump. (where n is the number of files created from the last step).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error with the text files being written to.
